We always prefer a shower cubicle nowadays but it was an awkward shower contraption over the bath - certainly would be awkward for less agile people. This was the only thing that let down our otherwise nice room.

Positive_reviews:
We like the position of this hotel - very close to Victoria Station. Its foyer and some other features suggest a five star establishment, but it is a different story once you are in your ageing and tatty room.
The restaurant serves excellent Italian food, although it is also used for breakfasts, which are chaotic and of poor quality.
Negative_reviews:
Where do we start? The staff are reminiscent of Manuel from Fawlty Towers - although his command of English and perception of guest needs were superior. The fact that it is virtually impossible to find a staff-member whose first language is English means that much is lost in the translation (either deliberately or otherwise). Our one-bedroom apartment (almost 350 pounds a night) could have been good if re-furbished, but it was in an appalling state of disrepair, with cupboard doors and drawers chipped and mal-aligned, a non-working dishwasher, large gouges out of the wooden floor (and parts of it that had lifted off completely), doors that didn't shut properly, a pungent and sickening influx of onion and garlic cooking smells several times a day, tatty furniture, no table to eat at, missing and mis-matched cutlery - the list goes on! The advertised coffee pods were not replaced each day (until we asked), and our bathrobes were removed during cleaning on the second day and had to be retrieved. The housekeeping was perfunctory and erratic. An extra 12.5% was added to our room service bill (not mentioned in the menu) and the quality of the food was mediocre. We took friends to the hotel's breakfast on one morning, and it was embarrassing - tired quintessential English greasy (and cold) hot dishes (one slice or two of congealed scrambled eggs? - with slightly exotic dishes such as eggs benedict or espresso coffee an extra cost). We reported the non-working dishwasher and onion smells to housekeeping and were assured that "maintenance" would look at it, but nothing happened.
All of this might have been predictable and tolerable had we been paying a third of the tariff we were charged, but it was unacceptble for the price.
We are a Booking.

Positive_reviews: The hotel is in a great location, within a short walking distance of Victoria Station (take the Wilton Road exit). It is easy to catch the underground from Heathrow, changing at Hammersmith (just cross the platform for the Circle Line there) with relatively few steps to negotiate with luggage at Victoria. You can walk to Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abby, Houses of Parliament, Whitehall etc, and catch tube connections to other destinations in London. There is a nice lobby in the hotel and it is in a quiet location, with comfortable rooms. There are shops (even a large Sainsburies) and restaurants close by. The Italian themed restaurant in the hotel is first class, and we thought that the room service was good quality. Overall we enjoyed the experience. It is pricey, but that is London.
Negative_reviews: We would stay here again because of the location, but the hotel could be even better if only there were more attention to some details. We stayed in a spacious one bedroom suite, with self-catering facilities. However, the carpets were filthy and torn/threadbare, the wooden floor in the lounge area was heavily damaged, the dishwasher didn't work (and wasn't fixed in the four days we stayed after reporting this) some light globes needed replacing, the furniture was very knocked about and internal doors were heavy to open and shut. The blind for the bathroom window was broken and the washbasin sprayed water in all directions (again, not attended to even though we had asked for it to be fixed). We needed to ask for sugar sachets (twice). Staff were friendly, but for most English was clearly their second language, and we suspect that some things just got lost in translation. What could have been an exceptional hotel (it has all the basics) was a little Fawlty Tower-ish in some aspects. The good outweighed the bad and we were in relaxed holiday mode, so we just laughed off these things, but it was sad that things could obviously have been much better with comparatively little needed to achieve that.

That caused the room to heat up quickly, during the hot days in this year's August the air conditioning could not cope with that. The cleaning staff opened the blinds every day so that the room heated up all day.
The bathroom needs renovation, the mirrors show large areas of rust. The shower cabin was severely leaking so the bathroom was flooded after each shower. 
There were no spots to hang the towels. There was no power outlet near a mirror, so using a blow dryer was kind of impossible. 
When opening the room door, the light in the bathroom was lit. It could only be switched off from a panel next to the bed - that means there was no way to discretely leave the room when one person woke up earlier, without waking the others up.
None of these flaws were major, but all in all our stay did not match the aspiration level of a park plaza hotel - nor did it match the paid price.
